title: (x) Two Heavy Moderns - Didoni, custom designed? {Tiff}
content:
The first one reminds me of the typeface Hubert Jocham designed for Frank magazine,   
but on his site he shows only an italic face.   
   
Where is the sample from, a fashion magazine?
author: defrancisco

comments.content:
The Rookledge shows a Pistilli Roman that looks awfully close.   
I'll check online for a bigger sample to compare.

wow! Mark posted a [sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123004231/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20933.html?1069782336) on another type ID thread but your sample looks heavier and wider. The letterforms are very similar, though.
Apparently the magazine page comes from a magazine called "Self

That would be [Self Service Magazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123004231/http:/www.selfservicemagazine.com/), a Parisian fashion mag. The art direction is by [Work in Progress](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123004231/http:/www.workinprogress.biz/), so maybe they know.
Just sorry I couldn't nail the id myself, Stewf. I hope the info is
Tiff, there might not be a bridge out of Brooklyn when the elephants invade on Monday. I know its going to be a mess.

Nice catch, Tiffany; I liked the "old school meets high fashion thing" going on in Stephen's sample, and now I can have it for a mere $20.   
   
Brilliant!
